data.title: Tim Ciciarelli - Vice President, Electrical/Systems Engineering at Invicta Medical
data.meta_description: Tim Ciciarelli has extensive work experience in the medical technology industry.
data.text:
Tim Ciciarelli has extensive work experience in the medical technology industry. Tim currently holds the position of Vice President of Electrical/Systems Engineering at Invicta Medical, a role they started in 2022. Prior to this, Tim served as the Vice President of Research and Development at Neuspera Medical Inc. from 2016 to 2022.

Tim also has a background with St. Jude Medical, where they held various positions in different divisions. From 2009 to 2016, they served as the Engineering Director at St. Jude Medical's Nanostim division. Before that, from 2000 to 2009, Tim worked at St. Jude Medical's Epicor division, starting as a Senior Engineer and gradually advancing to Director positions in Product Development and System Engineering. Tim's work at Epicor continued after the acquisition by St. Jude Medical in 2004.

Earlier in their career, Tim worked as a Project Engineer at Avocet Medical, Inc. from 1998 to 2000. Prior to that, they held engineering roles at St. Jude Medical's Ventritex division from 1996 to 1998, initially as a Design Engineer and then as a Senior Design Engineer. Ventritex was later acquired by St. Jude Medical in 1997.

Throughout their career, Tim has gained valuable experience and expertise in electrical and systems engineering, research and development, product development, and project management within the medical technology industry.

Tim Ciciarelli obtained a Bachelor of Science degree in Physics from the University of Virginia, where they studied from 1991 to 1995. Following this, they pursued a Master of Science degree in Electrical Engineering at Stanford University from 1995 to 1996.
